results.title: In the swim
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Frank Gardner
results.brief_description: Young British swimmers and divers demonstrate their prowess. Champions seen in action include Margaret Edwards and Margaret Austen, Ian Black and Brian Phelps. Describes the important points of style and movement which they use in different types of swimming strokes and high dives.

results.title: In the South seas: palm and steeple
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Gordon Babineau
results.brief_description: Interviews with foreign residents of the Solomon Islands provide a history of the involvement of plantation owners and Christian missions in the area. Contains very early footage of local customs. Narrated by George Woodcock.

results.title: In the South Seas
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and James Fitzpatrick
results.brief_description: This film is the record of an Australian scientific expedition to five remote villages in Papua, New Guinea and the Trobriand Islands, 150 miles off the East Coast of New Guinea. The expedition consisted of an agriculturalist, two nutritionists, a bio-chemist, a bacteriologist, an anthropologist, a dentist, a cinematographer, and a doctor. The aim of the expedition was to study the diet of the local people, how their food-stuffs are grown, what nutritional deficiencies they suffer from, what diseases - attributable to their diet or otherwise - they suffer from, and how their customs arising from the social structure of the tribe or village, controls or affects agriculture and hunting, and thus their diet and their health. Commentary by Wilfred Thomas.

results.title: In the shadows of the city [Widescreen] = Taif al madina = L'Ombre de la ville
results.creator_credit: Nour Productions, Mai Masri, Thierry Lenouvel and Jean Khalil Chamoun
results.brief_description: Director and writer Jean Khalil Chamoun through his prior knowledge and insight as a war reporter and producer for “Children of fire”, 1990 and “Children of Shatila”, 1998, provides with even-handedness, sensitivity, warmth and emotion, an in-depth study in this fictional drama of the underlying factors of the Lebanese Civil War. He incorporates the use of archival footage (mostly shot by Chamoun himself) to lend an air of realism in the depiction of the story about 12 year-old Rami (Rami Bayram) and his family who flee from the escalating conflict between Christians and Muslims in the countryside to settle in the safety of Beirut. We follow Rami into adulthood and a rapidly deteriorating Beirut as the city divides into Christian and Muslim sectors and spirals into an inevitable civil war causing turmoil and personal sorrow within Rami’s family and neighbouring families as they struggle with the reality of unemployment, death and the disappearance of loved ones. The eclectic mix of characters in this finely written story are portrayed by a superb cast including Majdi Machmouchi, Christine Choueiri, Ammar Chalak, Sara Mourad, and Ahmad Itani. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: In the Shadow of the Sun
results.creator_credit: James MacKay, Dark Pictures and Derek Jarman
results.brief_description: Derek Jarman shot the main sequences for this, his first lengthy film in the early ‘70s. Described as ‘very personal’ with a dream- like repetitive quality, the film expresses a mythology and dabbles with ideas relating to magic alchemy and ritual, allowing dream-images to drift and collide at random.

results.title: In the shadow of the stars: the lives of singers
results.brief_description: Insightful documentary that goes beyond the glamour of the big names to look at the unsung heroes of the opera: the men and women who comprise the chorus. The singers of the San Francisco Opera speak frankly about their lives, aspirations and their music. Their stories are funny poignant and inspiring. The “behind the scenes” footage is fascinating and enhances the picture of what it means to work as a performing artist for a major company such as the San Francisco Opera.

results.title: In the shadow of the chimney
results.brief_description: In Melbourne’s densely populated Western suburbs huge chemical, petroleum and manufacturing plants have been built very close to residential areas. Apart from the visual pollution they cause, these plants emit toxic wastes. The level of emissions is loosely regulated and poorly monitored. This video examines the danger posed by these plants, and shows how grass-roots community action can be successful in making both government and industry accountable for the well-being of residents and the environment.
